abstract: Viewers were back for more Jack Bauer (Keifer Sutherland) on Monday as part two of Fox’s seventh season premiere of “24” remained steady in the ratings, although the network trailed CBS for first place on the night over all.
snippet: Viewers were back for more Jack Bauer (Keifer Sutherland) on Monday as part two of Fox’s seventh season premiere of “24” remained steady in the ratings, although the network trailed CBS for first place on the night over all.
lead_paragraph: Viewers were back for more Jack Bauer (Kiefer Sutherland) on Monday as Part Two of Fox’s seventh season premiere of “24” remained steady in the ratings, although the network trailed CBS for first place on the night over all. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 12.3 million viewers tuned in for hours three and four of the terrorism series at 8 to 10 p.m., down about a quarter million viewers from the first installment on Sunday (12.6 million).
